title: 103_hr863
content:
The "Invest in the Deficit Act of 1993" requires new revenue or proceeds from asset sales to be used for reducing the federal budget deficit, with exceptions for deficit-free years. It also defines "new revenue" as additional receipts from new taxes or higher tax rates. Maximum deficit amounts and spending limits are set for fiscal years 1994-1998. The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 sets maximum deficit amounts and discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1994-1998. The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 sets discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1994-1998, with specific amounts allocated for the defense category each year. The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 sets discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1994-1998, with specific amounts allocated for the defense category each year. In fiscal year 1998, the budget authority for the international category is $264,651,000,000 with outlays of $273,861,000,000. In fiscal years 1996-1998, the budget authority and outlays for the defense category are as follows: 
- 1996: $36,732,000,000 in budget authority and $21,570,000,000 in outlays
- 1997: $37,980,000,000 in budget authority and $22,304,000,000 in outlays
- 1998: $39,272,000,000 in budget authority and $23,062,000,000 in outlays. The domestic category had $205,501,000,000 in budget authority and $228,997,000,000 in outlays for fiscal year 1994. In fiscal years 1996-1998, the budget authority and outlays for the defense category are as follows: 
- 1996: $36,732,000,000 in budget authority and $21,570,000,000 in outlays
- 1997: $37,980,000,000 in budget authority and $22,304,000,000 in outlays
- 1998: $39,272,000,000 in budget authority and $23,062,000,000 in outlays. The domestic category had $228,997,000,000 in outlays for fiscal year 1994. Amendments were made to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 regarding budget authority and outlays for fiscal years 1995-1998. Amendments to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 for fiscal years 1995-1998 include changes to various sections, such as inserting new years and updating references. Amendments are made to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. Amendments to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 include changes to Section 250(a) and Section 250(c), updating the years to 1998. Additionally, Section 251(a) and Section 251(b) are also amended to reflect the new year. Amendments to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 update the years to 1998 in various sections, including adjustments to inflation factors and timeframes. Amendments to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 update the years to 1998 in various sections, including inflation factors and timeframes adjustments. Amendments to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 update the years to 1998 in various sections, including inflation factors and timeframes adjustments. Section 254 is amended to update years to 1998 in subsections (c), (d)(2), and (g). Amendments update years to 1998 in various sections, including inflation factors and timeframes adjustments.
